subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice inflections?
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01F7_01CA36E4.94ED3F20
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

As far as I am concerned, for what it is worth-you seem to be going about i=
t the right way. As long as you remain open mindedly skeptical about any kn=
ew info, just as you did with the messages that were for you, there is no p=
roblem with it at all, IMO.

It sounds like you don't discount it and you d=
on't buy into it, you just file it away to see what comes of it later.

Per=
fect :)

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Misty Dawn 
  To: EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, September 16, 2009 3:30 PM
  Subject: R=
e: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice inflections?


    There is no doubt in my mind abou=
t that. You are right April =3D) In the beginning I did seek some proof for=
 my own sanity. But time and time again I have learned much more than I eve=
r expected to. For me its become more than about contact with my dead loved=
 ones, its more about learning and growing from the experiences. That defin=
itely has been the end result. 

        Misty

        --- On Wed, 9/16/09=
, April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:


         =
 From: April Abercrombie <april@...>
          Sub=
ject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice inflections?
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s.com
          Date: Wednesday, September 16, 2009, 5:14 PM


            =

          I would definitely call that proof. The strength of the proof is=
 in the part that you knew nothing about what the message would mean to the=
 person, or if it a message for you, it was some fact that you had not know=
n prior.

          IMO, in this case there is no way it would be a case ma=
trixing or hearing what you wanted or expected to hear, that it was real in=
formation conveyed through an intelligent source.

            ----- Origin=
al Message ----- 
            From: bulletbabea 
            To: EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups .com 
            Sent: Wednesday, September 16, 2009 2:46 PM
   =
         Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice inflections?


              
       =
     I think quite often when the message isn't for me and it's for someone=
 outside of this research it matters very much that the message is somethin=
g I myself would never know. It hits home so much more for the recipient. T=
o me it may seem dumb or meaningless but to the person who the message is f=
or it can have a deeper impact because they know theres no way possible I c=
ould know the info. And vice versa when the message is for me sometimes the=
 info doesnt become clear til much later down the road when I learn that bi=
t of info or watch that predictive message become reality. It's all very in=
teresting and educational =3D)

            Misty

            --- In EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups .com, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
            >
 =
           > The only way to prove 100% that something you receive through =
the box is authentic communication, is if they say something that you can v=
erify, something you yourself did not know.
            > 
            > --=
--- Original Message ----- 
            > From: Misty Dawn 
            > T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            > Sent: Wednesday, September 16, 2=
009 3:41 AM
            > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Voice inflections?
       =
     > 
            > 
            > I have gotten many life like voices ov=
er the years. My first evp was my mothers voice and no boxes were involved.=
 The box is a tool/method and there are many ways to get their voices heard=
. So in the different methods I have used, yes I have heard voices that res=
emble their lifetime charachteristics and tones. Is it always that way? No.=
 
            > 
            > Most often the group will speak as one voice=
 because I have requested they do so. One voice tone will begin a sentence =
and another will end it. So I may hear my female friends voice start off a =
thought and an unknown male voice finish the sentence. And vice versa often=
 they speak in tones which do not even come close to what they sounded like=
 in life. Quite often they are spirits I didnt know in life. I may get some=
one saying This is edison, and then find an old recording he did where he s=
tarts it off saying This is edison, but for me I do not know the man so the=
re is no recognition for me. I document it and file it away as a curiousity=
.
            > 
            > I always laugh when people say thats not you=
r mother or friend thats something trying to fool you and mess with your he=
ad. I knew my mother longer than anyone and its interesting that it is easi=
er for those people to believe that its possible that something/someone els=
e is speaking pretending to be my mother but its much harder for them to be=
lieve that quite possibly that really is my mother keeping her promise to s=
tay in touch after death. If one is possible then so is the other. I tend t=
o be stubborn in some respects in that I dont instantly believe what anyone=
 tells me whether living or not. If they give me a message I think is dumb =
I am very reluctant to pass it on and usually those are the ones that get t=
he biggest confirmations tho it means nothing to me at the time. So yes qui=
te possibly evp work can be used the same as mediumship in missing persons =
cases.
            > 
            > For me tone of voice has grown to mean =
nothing. It is a treat when they manage to come across sounding as they did=
 when in physical form here but I look beyond the tone of voice. Often peop=
le get a childs voice and they become saddened by the thought that a child =
is earthbound. But I see it just as a representation of voice and whether i=
t comes across as male female child or robot matters little to me.
        =
    > 
            > I do find they often resume the "character" they playe=
d because after all that is sort of what we are, characters in some giant p=
lay. Whether it is the beliefs they had which were their trademark, the ton=
e of voice, their image, or use of some nickname even I dont know about I l=
ook at it all as just a pixel in a larger portrait that some part survives =
once the body has ceased to function. And the message is simply, our energy=
 continues on.
            > 
            > Quote by Einstein: 'Energy cann=
ot be created or destroyed, it can only be changed from one form to another=
.'
            > 
            > Misty (the insomniac is up way tooooo late =
and rambling on LOL)
            > 
            > --- On Tue, 9/15/09, mrsc=
aptainjack2 <jjkamp@...> wrote:
            > 
            > 
            >=
 From: mrscaptainjack2 <jjkamp@...>
            > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Voice =
inflections?
            > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
            > Date:=
 Tuesday, September 15, 2009, 9:56 PM
            > 
            > 
       =
     > 
            > I was googling about AM radio reception, and I came a=
cross the below exchange on a forum. It talks about using the box to find m=
issing persons (which I didn't know was possible), and the conversation men=
tions hearing specific voice inflections and recognizing a dead person's sp=
ecific voice on the box. My question is, do any of you get a recognizable v=
oice? The voices I get always sound robotic, although I do get clearly male=
 or female voices. 
            > 
            > http://www.itcbridg e.com/=
forum/ view_topic. php?id=3D515& forum_id=3D 31
            >
